title: Deep Q-Learning Networks (DQNs)

definitions.Q-function: By using a neural network to approximate the Q-function, which estimates the expected cumulative reward for each action in a given state, Deep Q-Learning can handle environments with large state spaces.
definitions.Deep Q-Learning: It aims to enable agents to learn optimal actions in complex, high-dimensional environments.

summary: The slide discusses Deep Q-Learning Networks (DQNs), which use a neural network to approximate the Q-function for estimating expected cumulative rewards in complex environments. It includes a diagram showing the flow from state to multiple Q-Value Actions.
